text: Yes, that was a great kickoff. I’m excited to help move this along.

elements.text: Yes, that was a great kickoff. I’m excited to help move this along.

text: First issue created to start discussion: <https://github.com/WebOfTrust/ietf-did-keri/issues/2>

elements.text: First issue created to start discussion:

attachments.fallback: #2 Mapping of Keys to Verification Methods and Relationships
attachments.text:
The goal is to define a univocal mapping between the keys in the KEL and the `verificationMethod` property, and the Verification Relationships `authentication`, `assertionMethod`, `keyAgreement`, `capabilityInvocation` and `capabilityDelegation` properties of the DID Document.

From <https://github.com/pfeairheller|@pfeairheller> <https://keriworld.slack.com/archives/C0552BPRN5D/p1682704423143979|presentation>:

• Verification Methods:
    • KERI public signing keys
    • Other keys committed to by AID
        • Keys derived from public signing keys (encryption)
        • Anchored in KEL (using cryptographic digest)
        • BADA (Best Available Data Acceptance) Policy
• Verification Relationships:
    • Authentication and assertion assigned to KERI public keys
    • Other types represented by key role BADA data

From <https://github.com/WebOfTrust/ietf-did-keri|ietf-did-keri>:

> For each key K in the Key State, add a Verification Method to the DID Doc containing K and the appropriate type, with the ID of K being K's prefix form (alternatively, the ID could be an integer of K's index in the current signer list)

I think we need to start defining:

• How to identify other keys anchored in the KEL. Should a specific seal format be defined to cover all possible cases defined in the DID Spec?
• key Id generation for each key
• Mapping of BADA roles to relationships
attachments.title: #2 Mapping of Keys to Verification Methods and Relationships

text:
So you wanna see the DID Doc for the production GLEIF Root of Trust Identifier?

Try this:  `did:web:<http://verifiablelei.org:gleif:root:EDP1vHcw_wc4M__Fj53-cJaBnZZASd-aMTaSyWEQ-PC2|verifiablelei.org:gleif:root:EDP1vHcw_wc4M__Fj53-cJaBnZZASd-aMTaSyWEQ-PC2>`.

The Universal Resolver seemed to like it!

The DID Doc is auto-generated from the key event log of the KERI AID live at every resolution.  This will track all key state changes and updates to service endpoints.

This particular web service is also configured for GLEIF External and GLEIF Internal.  It could be used by anyone to expose any KERI AID as a did:web DID.

The other two are:

`did:web:<http://verifiablelei.org:gleif:internal:EFcrtYzHx11TElxDmEDx355zm7nJhbmdcIluw7UMbUIL|verifiablelei.org:gleif:internal:EFcrtYzHx11TElxDmEDx355zm7nJhbmdcIluw7UMbUIL>`
`did:web:<http://verifiablelei.org:gleif:external:EINmHd5g7iV-UldkkkKyBIH052bIyxZNBn9pq-zNrYoS|verifiablelei.org:gleif:external:EINmHd5g7iV-UldkkkKyBIH052bIyxZNBn9pq-zNrYoS>`

This is _not_ a did method specification or resolver for did:keri.  It is a utility for KERI AID controllers.

elements.text:
So you wanna see the DID Doc for the production GLEIF Root of Trust Identifier?

Try this:  `did:web:verifiablelei.org:gleif:root:EDP1vHcw_wc4M__Fj53-cJaBnZZASd-aMTaSyWEQ-PC2`.

The Universal Resolver seemed to like it!

The DID Doc is auto-generated from the key event log of the KERI AID live at every resolution.  This will track all key state changes and updates to service endpoints.

This particular web service is also configured for GLEIF External and GLEIF Internal.  It could be used by anyone to expose any KERI AID as a did:web DID.

The other two are:

`did:web:verifiablelei.org:gleif:internal:EFcrtYzHx11TElxDmEDx355zm7nJhbmdcIluw7UMbUIL`
`did:web:verifiablelei.org:gleif:external:EINmHd5g7iV-UldkkkKyBIH052bIyxZNBn9pq-zNrYoS`

This is _not_ a did method specification or resolver for did:keri.  It is a utility for KERI AID controllers.

text: Nice!. We can talk about that at keri dev meeting tomorrow.

text: After a day long discussion from members of the DID community, I'm going to amend my comment...  this _should_ be did:keri.  And a properly built did:keri resolver that is implemented this way can also masquerade as a did:web endpoint for the same AIDs.  If you access the did:keri variant you use a did:keri resolver and get the full response with DID Doc, Resolution and Document Metadata which would include the KEL and rpy messages.  Fully end verifiable.  If you access the did:web endpoint, you get the DID Doc so it will work when accessed from a did:web resolver. (like the current version is doing).

Fully end verifiable.  If you access the did:web endpoint, you get the DID Doc so it will work when accessed from a did:web resolver. (like the current version is doing).
